data.title: Author Comments
data.text:
Comment

I wanted to take a few minutes to respond to your letter. Working with the Bentham Science Editorial team has been a very rewarding experience for me. I find the staff highly trained, organized and professional. This experience has made it a pleasure to publish with Bentham Sciences because the support is so helpful. Staff have been encouraging, patient and very detail oriented while helping me to fine-tune my manuscript(s) into their final format ready for public viewing. Publishing is a challenge for me due to time constraints and a full-time teaching assignment but working with the Bentham Science group has been a pleasure.

Kimberly A. Stieglitz

STEM Biotechnology Division, Roxbury Community College, Roxbury, MA

United States

Comment

Thank you for contacting me. In regards to feedback on my experience working with this publisher, my only complaint is that the peer review process seemed to take longer than expected (about 2 months), and I received comments from 4 reviewers rather than the usual 2. Because each reviewer had several requests/questions, it took me a significant amount of time to make edits to the manuscript prior to re-submission. The online submission process was relatively straightforward. Your publication manager, Iqra Khalid, was very helpful and prompt in responding to my questions.

Christiana Elizabeth Smith

Department of Pediatric Infectious Diseases, University of Colorado School of Medicine, Aurora, CO

United States

Comment

I appreciate your support on these process. It was an honour to publish in your prestigious journal.

Those are the words: " Publish with Bentham Sciences is join the researchers in a big network science friendship relationship around the world"

Thanks a lot

Patricia Durn Ospina

Fundacin Universitaria del rea Andina Colombia, Pereira

United States

Comment

The editorial staff and editor were great to work with. They kept us up-to-date and informed about the status of our manuscript. The peer review process was performed very efficiently and effectively. The reviewers did an excellent job of identifying gaps and asking relevant questions that improved the quality of the manuscript. We were very pleased with the quality of the reviews and the assistance of the reviewers. The journal has published overall good/high quality papers and is becoming recognized as an impactful resource for scientific thought and outcomes. Based on our experience as contributors to the journal and the quality of papers published in the journal, I would recommend to my colleagues that they strongly consider the journal for their future publications.

Milton Sommerfeld

Arizona Center for Algae Technology and Innovation,

Arizona State University, Mesa, AZ, 85212

Comment

I am very pleased with the quality of service that I received from every part of Bentham Science, including your journal, Current Drug Discovery Technologies. First, let me thank you and the editor for inviting me to submit a review article. The 2nd edition was written as a text for the first semester of the two semester course in medicinal chemistry that is taught in pharmacy schools around the world. Bentham Science is doing a great job of helping my books reach the market.

At the same time, the article I wrote for Current Drug Discovery Technologies gave me an opportunity to reach a broader audience than the one that I reach in my research on food and natural products chemistry at the FDA. It also gave me the opportunity to review the very important subject of allo-network drugs, which has emerged recently and is described in more detail in the 3rd edition. The review process was fast and efficient. It caught the mistakes that I made and recommended several important improvements. The final proofs look excellent.

The other thing that Bentham Science has done for me is to greatly increase my scientific reputation, which has led to several other publishers inviting me to write review articles for them. In conclusion, Bentham Science continues to support my career and I hope that you have found me to be a valuable contributor.

Robert E. Smith

U.S. FDA, 11510 W 80th St., Lenexa, KS 66214

USA

Comment

"I found the editorial staff of Current Biotechnology friendly and helpful. I appreciate the interaction at the end when important decisions had to be made, and the editors were helpful and accommodating. The peer review process was at a very acceptable rate. Most of the reviewers suggestions helped to improve the quality of our manuscript. I think there is a lot of scope as the area is rapidly growing and it will be a very important journal in the field. I will certainly look into publishing with you again."

Abigail Elizur

Queensland Department of Employment, Economic Development and Innovation, Bribie Island Research Centre, Queensland

Australia

Comment

I have a very good experience working with the Bentham Science Publishers through my long-term relationship with one of the imaging journals, Current Medical Imaging (CMIM, previously named Current Medical Imaging Reviews). Previously I served as an editorial board member of CMIR, then was promoted to section editor, then to Co-editor in CMIM in 2020. I have published in many imaging and medical journals, thus having experience with different publishers such as Springer, Elsevier, AME Publishing Company, and Wiley, etc. My experience with Bentham Science Publishers is generally positive due to its excellent service, taking care of the authorâ€™s request, and the high quality of published articles. My only comment on future improvement is to shorten response time as I realized that it takes a few days (sometimes even longer) to respond to my query, such as after checking the first round of galley proof, I have to wait for another week or even longer to receive the corrected proof. This is rarely encountered with other publishers. Fast turnaround time is very important for authors nowadays as we would like to speed up our publications including citations of articles that are online.

Zhonghua Sun

Department of Medical Radiation Sciences Curtin University, Perth,

Australia

Comment

This was my first submission to Current Biotechnology so, understandably, I was a bit apprehensive to try a new publisher. However, I was very pleased with the process and particularly the very kind and helpful interactions I had with the EiC and all of the members of the CBIOT team. The peer review process was thorough but also timely and the reviews improved the quality of the final manuscript. It is a great honour for me to have one of my papers published in this journal and I will certainly be submitting future manuscripts.

Comment

I would like to congratulate you on the great work on our paper in Current Nanoscience.

All the people in Bentham Science have been very helpful, prompt when I needed assistance and have exhibited a high level of professionalism.

It is very likely that I will consider your journal for the submission of papers in the future and I will recommend it to my colleagues.

Angelos P. Markopoulos

Section of Manufacturing Technology, School of Mechanical Engineering, National Technical University of Athens, Athens

Greece

Comment

My experience of working with Bentham Science Publication Current Computer-Aided Drug Design has been excellent. I was provided with all the necessary information, as well as friendly reminders within deadlines. The organization is very professional and I would be pleased to collaborate again with the journal in the future.

I would also like to acknowledge the high level of everyone else who was responsible for the editing and processing of documents for the best final quality at the time of publication.

Pedro A. Alemn

The Department of Pharmacy, Faculty of Health Sciences, CEU Cardenal Herrera University, P.O. Box: 46113, Moncada

Spain

Comment

In the last three years I published three reviews about neural networks and the resulting pharmacotherapy in diseases such as generalized epilepsy, major depression in two Bentham Science Publishers journals: Current Medicinal Chemistry and Current Drug Therapy. The reviews reached a large diffusion and were quoted several times in other scientific works. Through this activity, I was also able to assist for the second time actively at the International Conference on Drug Discovery and Therapy in Dubai.

I am very satisfied with the cooperation from Bentham Service Publishers, and I would like to mention the excellent communication and the technical assistance in the publication of my article. I will go on working to examine neural networks in neurological and psychiatric diseases in order to optimize a multimodal pharmacotherapy.

Felix-Martin Werner

Institute of Neuroscience of Castilla and Len, Laboratorio de los Sistemas Peptidrgicos

Spain

Comment

In the last three years I published three reviews about neural networks and the resulting pharmacotherapy in diseases such as generalized epilepsy, major depression in two Bentham Science Publishers journals: Current Medicinal Chemistry and Current Drug Therapy. The reviews reached a large diffusion and were quoted several times in other scientific works. Through this activity, I was also able to assist for the second time actively at the International Conference on Drug Discovery and Therapy in Dubai.

I am very satisfied with the cooperation from Bentham Service Publishers, and I would like to mention the excellent communication and the technical assistance in the publication of my article. I will go on working to examine neural networks in neurological and psychiatric diseases in order to optimize a multimodal pharmacotherapy.

Felix-Martin Werner

Institute of Neuroscience of Castilla and Len, Laboratorio de los Sistemas Peptidrgicos

Spain

Comment

Our contribution was a review article entitled Lipid Metabolism During Pregnancy and its Implications for Fetal Growth, having Herrera, E. and Ortega-Senovilla, H. as authors.

We were invited by Dr. ZanetaKimber-Trojnar to contribute with a review article about some selected aspects of lipid metabolism/disturbances in pregnancy patients. After accepting to write our article I may say that our relationship with Dr. Kimber-Trojnar was very fluid and easy.

We also have had a nice and easy relation with the Sr. Manager Publications of Bentham Science Publishers, with regards to handling the proofs.

Thank you very much for your attention.

Emilio Herrera

Universidad San Pablo CEU

Spain

Comment

It was an excellent experience to publish my work in Current Biotechnology. Both the EiC as well as the editorial staff responded directly to our questions and helped us a lot. The peer review process was rapid and efficient. The suggestions and remarks of the reviewers and the editorial staff helped us a lot to improve the manuscript. The journal is relatively new, and has to compete with a large number of online journals in the same field, but the dedication of the EiC and editorial staff, as well as the efficient reviewing and publishing process, will eventually make the difference. CBIOT has the potential to find a stable position (niche') within the number of high quality journals publishing articles in the field of biotechnology.

Gerard Muyzer

Department of Aquatic Microbiology, Institute for Biodiversity and Ecosystems Dynamics, University of Amsterdam, Amsterdam

The Netherlands

Comment

The communication and information supply by the editorial staff and EiC was open, friendly, to the point, and fast. Also their help in getting the required adjustments to the figures done in an efficient way was very much appreciated. The peer review process was fast for the first review, but the response on my resubmission took longer. The reviewers suggestions were helpful in improving the manuscript. The overall quality and authority of the journal is good; good scientific papers in diverse fields of Biotechnology; the special issues with themes of current interest are also adding to the quality of the journal, and a reason to recommend it to colleagues.

Margot E.F. Schooneveld

DSM Biotechnology Center, Alexander Fleminglaan 1, 2613 AX Delft

The Netherlands

Comment

I have enjoyed very much working with Bentham Science Publishers. The reviewers and the editors, especially the editor in chief Prof. Mikhailidis, have been extremely helpful with their constructive comments, which have improved our paper considerably. Also, the author guidelines found on your website are very clear and easy to follow. The main reason why I chose your journal is that it is indexed in pubmed and medline, as well as in many other important databases. The only one missing, which could add real value to your journal, is science direct (http://www.sciencedirect.com); so this is the only thing that could be improved. Other than that, everything was perfect.

Nikolaos Louvis

Clinical Pharmacologist, Community Pharmacist; Department of Pharmacology, Therapeutics & Toxicology, Cardiff University

United Kingdom

Comment

it has been a real pleasure to have worked with BSP. This is not my first experience with Bentham Science and I have always been happy to publish in your journals. People from BSP are helpful, even if the work is hard for them sometimes . Many details are required and you have to have a rigorous correspondence with the authors, reviewers, editors and editorial assistantsto resend lost mails, to look for final acceptance and publication of Special issues.

Nevertheless , the final product let you forget all the effort and we have been always very satisfied with it. In conclusion, thanks for the opportunity you provided me and my co-worker Dr. Francesco Paolo Busard to work with you and for you.

Simona Pichini

National Centre on Addiction and Doping, Istituto Superiore di Sanit, V.Le Regina Elena 299, 00161 Rome

Italy

Has contributed following article:

Method Development In Forensic Toxicology

Comment

It was great for me to publish with Bentham Science Publishers. The whole process of submitting the paper, its peer review, the acceptance and post acceptance processes were quite fast and I never had any problems of getting in touch with either the editor or the publishing staff regarding the progress of publishing. In particular I wish to thank Sidra Aftab, Sr. Manager Publications, for her constant support and kindness.

Moreover I am quite impressed by the high quality of Bentham Science publications, which are of great benefit to all researchers and students around the world to get information on state-of-the-art technologies.

With the kind of experience that I have had, I would love to publish with Bentham Science again in the future too and, in particular, to support your prestigious Journal, Current Nanoscience, of which I am honoured to be an Editorial Board Member."

Anna Gina Perri

Politecnico di Bari, Bari

Italy

Comment

I am very satisfied of my collaboration with the journal Current Neuropharmacology and Bentham Science Publishers. I received constant support from the journal manager, when requested, and the production was rapid and efficient. Plus, the quality of the galley proofs was excellent.

With regard to my publication (and the whole special issue), I think it can be of interest for the academia and industry, as it describes a new method that can be used in behavioral neuropharmacology and drug screening. Therefore, the reviews reported in the special issue may attract interest from the researchers working in the drug discovery and drug evaluation fields.

Nicola Simola

Department of Biomedical Sciences, Section of Neuropsychopharmacology, University of Cagliari, Via Ospedale, 72, 09124, Cagliari

Italy

Comment

We would like to express our gratitude to Bentham Science Publishers for the wonderful experience while working with the journal on this mini-thematic issue. There are several reasons for this enthusiasm.

We are grateful to the Editor-in-Chief, Dr Francis J. Castellino, for contacting us and offering us the chance to publish in Current Drug Targets, and accepting our proposal for a mini-thematic issue. It was a wonderful experience working with Shabana Seemee at the time of submission and processing of the papers. Shabana was always ready to support us whenever we had either a problem or a query.

We would like to acknowledge the high standard of all others who took care of editing and processing the papers to obtain the best final quality at the time of publication.

We would be delighted to continue to collaborate with the journal.

Rodolfo Montironi

University of the Marche Region, School of Medicine, United Hospitals

Italy

Comment

"Publishing with Bentham in my experience has always been a great pleasure; I never had problems or unnecessary delays, and regarding the points raised by the Referee's .Even if they required a lot of changes, it always led to an improvement in the manuscript quality; thus, a special thanks for the referee's work and quality.

I would also like to appreciate the Editor of the journal, as he was able to select competent people for this crucial task.

Additionally, it is always a pleasure to read articles published in Current Medicinal Chemistry; owing to their quality and the up-to-date topics. Current Medicinal Chemistry is one of the few journals that I check every month. In particular, my last submission is of interest for both pharmaceutical and biomedical industry.

L. Costantino

University of Modena e Reggio

Italy

Comment

My experience with Bentham Science Publishers is a few years old, and it isgetting better and better with time!In my opinion, Bentham Science Publishers is about to reach the maturity level in the publishing industry. I like the attempts to create new electronic submission system. Furthermore, Ilike the huge array of titles and the possibilities to publish in the concept of open access.

My interaction with the Editors has always been very well and I appreciate the understanding of the real and everyday scientific work handled by them.

Thanks to Bentham Science Publishers, the promotion of scientific achievements has reached a level globally.

Tomasz Baczek

Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry

Poland

Comment

I would like to specify that working with Bentham Sciences was a pleasure. We sent two articles to Bentham Sciences; one of them was published in Current Drug Metabolism and the other one is awaiting revision in Combinatorial Chemistry & High Throughput Screening. I believe that Bentham Sciences works with experienced reviewers and editors who are experts in their specific area. All comments and feedbacks have always made our articles much better. It was a pleasure to work with such experts and Bentham Science.

Sinan SUZEN

Ankara University, Faculty of Pharmacy, Department of Toxicology, Tandogan, TR-06100, Ankara-

TURKEY

Comment

It was indeed a nice experience to work with the publication team of Current Organic Chemistry, during the submission and revision process of my manuscript. I was assisted at every stage of the publishing process and my queries were dealt promptly. However, I would like to see the reviewing process after the submission of the revised manuscript, to be a little bit faster. Apart from that, I am really impressed with the professionalism and sincerity shown by the entire publication team. I am indeed interested in publishing more of my work in Bentham Science journals, and I hope to have more interactions with your publication team in the future.

Aditya Bhattacharyya

Department of Chemistry, Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur, 208016, Kanpur, Uttar Pradesh

India

Comment

It is my great pleasure to have the opportunity to contribute articles to Current Medicinal Chemistry, which is a leading international journal in the medicinal chemistry domain. We would like to express our great appreciations to the editors and the reviewers for the constructive advice shared with us for the revision of our manuscripts. The suggestions were really helpful! Additionally, it is really a great pleasure to collaborate with the managers of Bentham Science Publications since they are kind and helpful. I am looking forward to continue working with the team of Bentham Science Publishers in the near future.

Jiahua Cui

Department of Applied Biology and Chemical Technology, State Key Laboratory of Chirosciences, Hong Kong Polytechnic University, Hong Kong SAR

China

Comment

I am happy that I have successfully completed the Thematic Issue and more so because I have been given Bentham Ambassadorship for India. The quality of papers are excellent in the issues, therefore, it is obvious that significant citations and appreciations would be received. I am already being asked about the issue and pdf copies of the papers over Researchgate etc.

It was a great experience with your team, they deserve a big round of applause. They have even considered some of our late submissions and managed to complete everything as quickly as they can.

There are several things what can be mentioned but I will stop here with the note that I am looking forward to work on another Issue with your team in the future. I hope I have not troubled them too much during this exercise.

Sanjay Singh

Division of Biological and Life Sciences School of Arts and Sciences Ahmedabad University, Ahmedabad, 380009, Gujarat

India

Comment

First of all, I want to thank you for accepting our manuscript to publish in one of your journals, Mini-Reviews in Organic Chemistry. I want remark the process of revision according to reviewersâ€™ comments. All of these comments gave us the knowledge how to make a good review. This is very useful for us. Furthermore, the whole process run very smoothly and did not take long time. Communication was also very good and clear. Hopefully Bentham Science Publisher will continue to grow so that all the journals will also increase in quality. Thank you.

Alfinda Novi Kristanti

Department of Chemistry, Faculty of Science and Technology, Universitas Airlangga, Surabaya 60115

Indonesia

Has contributed following article:

Review: Secondary Metabolites Of Aquilaria, A Thymelaeaceae Genus

Comment

"We would like to thank the entire editing team of Current Drug Delivery (CDD) for its commitment to resolving all issues regarding the publication of our article. All sectors work in consonance and are quite agile. We believe that our work is of interest both in the pharmaceutical and in the biotechnology industry, since once the bioavailability of the active substance is guaranteed at its site of action, the better the result for the patient. And so it is in the interest of a whole chain of health goods production, to encourage them to study this issue of biopharmaceutical stability in more depth. At the moment, Mrs. Perissinato is working with ophthalmic release systems, it is still in progress. Dr. Trevisan is working on the same issue: characterization/stability of solid-state formulations and development of analytical methods. We look forward to future contributions to your journal."

Aline Gravinez Perissinato

LACFAR, Institute of Chemistry, Federal University of Alfenas, Alfenas

Brazil

Comment

Mini Reviews in Medicinal Chemistry published by Bentham Science Publishers, is of interest to all fraternity from science fields in general and Pharma in specific. Publication in MRMC (a well established journal with good impact factor) provides a good opportunity for those who want to develop their experience of academic practice and who are seeking professional recognition. I am really impressed with editorial handling and rigorous reviewing process of our manuscript . Sincere thanks for supportive and constructive comments from the reviewers and editor. â€œVery professional approach with great attention to all the technical details with immediate and helpful responses to all raised queries/ problem.â€ The entire process was very transparent and friendly. It would be our great pleasure to contribute to Pharma society by sharing our knowledge and research experience through MRMC journal in future too.

Neelima Dhingra

Assisatant Professor, UIPS,PU Chandigarh

India

Has contributed following article:

Phytotherapeutic Agents for Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia: An Overview

Comment

I would like to thank Bentham Science Publishers for their peerless effort to keep up scientists and students updated with the latest science and research work. Actually, Bentham assists researchers to achieve their goals to spread their reputation worldwide. I have experienced sincere, efficient and effective communication while dealing with Bentham team members. I intend to submit my work to Bentham and try to pick up journals that match my research profile. I have submitted a recent work to Medicinal Chemistry and nowadays I am drafting a manuscript targeting Current Pharmaceutical Design. Honestly, no words neither sentences would express my gratefulness and admiration. Bentham has offered my institution three months trial to access their journal lists and surf on its Board. This free access trial fulfills my literature review and broadens my horizon to absorb the recent research in pharmaceutical sciences and medicinal chemistry. Finally, I wish Bentham more success and achievement!

Dima Sabbah

Department of Pharmacy, Faculty of Pharmacy, Al-Zaytoonah University of Jordan, Amman

Jordan

Comment

We truly are grateful for providing us the opportunity to work with Bentham Science Publishers. The scientific customary of this journal is incredibly high, furthermore, the publication procedure has been competent in addition to smooth. The staff of editorial office has all the time been exceptionally co-operative in addition to giving a rapid response to the e-mails throughout the process of review. We are thankful to the Editor-in-Chief, our manuscript is likely to be of importance to the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industry. My experience with Bentham Science Publishers is exceptionally encouraging. The editorial team is incredibly proficient which facilitated speedy accomplishment of the publication process. We would be excited to keep on collaborating with MRMC and other similar journals.

Chandra Kant Sharma

Department of Bioscience and Biotechnology, Faculty of Science and Technology, Banasthali University, Rajasthan 304022

India

Comment

"My Experience of working and dealing with Bentham is beyond horizon and couldn't be expressed in few words. I like the instant reply and communications etiquette as well as respectful email messages. Actually, Bentham Journals are my favorite journals so I intend to submit my work to the highest reputable Publishers. I have 8 published articles as first author or coauthor in Bentham Journals. I am preparing two articles right now and I would like to extend my publications in Bentham Journals to approve my goals as a scientific researchers.

Dima A. Sabbah

Faculty of Pharmacy, Al-Zaytoonah University of Jordan

Jordan

Comment

It is an honour to be asked to write a few words about my experience of working with Bentham Science Publishers, ""Letters in Drug Design & Discovery"". It is one of the few journals that enables authors to publish quality research in an open format, with no page charges.

Everyone that I have had to communicate with has been exceptionally helpful and thorough with their review and responses. I feel that the Bentham Science Publication in general and LDDD in particular will go on to achieve a great impact in the publication society as a highly respected forum for accessing perfect quality manuscripts. I want to express my gratitude to the choice of excellent reviewers, who added valuable comments in order to get a better manuscript. Im most grateful and appreciate Dr.Tabinda Rao Editorial Manager Publications of the journal for her replies to all of my questions quickly and directly and for being such a positive influence.

Weiam Hussein

Anadolu University, Faculty of Pharmacy, Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Eskisehir

Turkey

Comment

I am very glad that you considered our article (Reference#: BSP-LDDD-2017-1848) for publication in your journal. I would like to inform you that I am pleased with the quality of your services. The peer review process was very efficient. The comments were very helpful in improving the manuscript. So we want to express our sincere thanks to you and all the editors, as well as reviewers in Letters in Drug Design & Discovery. I am very confident that LDDD is going to grow further in the future. Wishing you all the best.

Glhan Turan-Zitouni

Anadolu University, Faculty of Pharmacy, Department of Pharmaceutical Chemistry, Eskisehir

Turkey

Comment

"With years of experience in cooperation with Bentham Science Publishers, I can point out the exceptional professionalism, expediency and cordiality of your staff. These are the reasons why I will be happy to continue with publishing my research in your publications.

Taking into account the topic of research, unfortunately, I doubt it might be of interest to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology or the biomedical industry.

If I found that some of the projects, in which I am involved, might be of interest to you, I will certainly let you know."

Djordje S. Popovic

Clinic for Endocrinology, Diabetes and Metabolic Disorders, Clinical Center of Vojvodina, Medical Faculty, University of Novi Sad

Serbia

Comment

I am highly obliged that Bentham accepted my manuscript and I got an opportunity to work with the same. I came across a lot of new things while doing the revision of my article and I think that would help me compose a much better article in future. Also, everything was done promptly like sending corrections, replying to my queries and so on, without any delay. No wonder, Bentham has such a good name in the field of publishers !

Huda Ansari

SVKM's Dr.Bhanuben Nanavati College of Pharmacy

India

Comment

I would like to sincerely thank you for your considerate services. The most impressive things of your services are detailed explanation and patience on my delay, while the only little deficiency is that the peer reviewing process takes a long time. In general, we are satisfied with your kind services, and I sincerely hope that we could have a good cooperation in the future too. Once again, we appreciate you for the best possible services and products you provide.

Yujie Ren

School of Chemical and Environmental Engineering, Shanghai Institute of Technology, Shanghai, P.R.

China

Comment

I would like to thank the entire editing team of the Current Drug Delivery for their commitment to resolve all issues regarding the publication of my article. All sectors work in consonance and are quite agile. I believe that my work is of interest both in the pharmaceutical industry and in the biotechnology industry, since once the bioavailability of the active substance is guaranteed at its site of action, the better is the result for the patient. And so it is in the interest of the whole chain of health goods production, to encourage them to study this issue of biopharmaceutical stability in depth. At the moment I am working with ophthalmic release systems, which is still in progress. I look forward to future contributions to your journal.

Aline Gravinez Perissinato

LACFAR, Institute of Chemistry, Federal University of Alfenas, Alfenas

Brazil

Comment

Although RPME was not the highest ranked journal that I published in, but my experience with this journal was the best among all the journals. Professor Zaman, who is the chief editor of the journal was the primary person responsible for this good experience along with the supporting staff of your publication. There was no compromise on the quality as well. If you guys continue to work with this zeal, I am hopeful the publication will have a very bright future. Good luck!

Akash Dixit

Graphic Era University, Dehradun

India

Has contributed following article:

Structural Health Monitoring Systems And Methods

Comment

"Thank you for your e-mail regarding our paper published in ""Mini-Reviews in Medicinal Chemistry"".

"While my association with Bentham Science Publishers both as an author and a reviewer has been for more than 10 years, however, this is my first paper in MRMC. I have published several articles in various journals of Bentham Science Publishers earlier and my publishing experiences have been excellent so far. Also, I have noted that over the years journals published by Bentham Science are playing a commendable role in disseminating information and knowledge particularly in the areas of Medical sciences. I shall certainly continue to submit my future research work to this or other appropriate journals of Bentham Science."

Manojit Pal

Institute of Life Sciences, University of Hyderabad Campus, Hyderabad-500 046

India

Comment

I would like to express my gratitude and appreciation to Bentham Science Publishers. I am highly impressed and thankful, for the amazing job you have done in bringing out to the world what had been an idea and a dream that will completely alter the course of diabetic medication. The editors and reviewers are extremely efficient. Any issues I have had, have been dealt with quickly, although publishing an article can be extremely stressful sometimes, they made the process easy. It was a great experience. I appreciated being kept up to date at every stage. I appreciated all the input I received. I am the novice here and you are the experts. Thank you very much.

Salihu Ibrahim Ismail

Department of Biochemistry, College of Medicine and Health Sciences, Federal University, Dutse

Nigeria

Comment

I would like to thank Bentham Science Publishers for their efficient handling of our recent manuscript in Current Medicinal Chemistry (CMC). The entire review and editorial process were dealt with to our utmost satisfaction. In this connection, we would especially like to mention Ms Beenish Anwer for being so prompt and efficient in answering our queries and addressed some unexpected issues that surfaced during the review process. The comments by all reviewers on the manuscript were constructive and focused which had helped improve the presentation of the review article. I have published papers including reviews in many journals over the years, CMC should be ranked one the best in terms of its editorial and publication processes. Thank you.

Eng-Ang Ling

Emeritus Professor, Department of Anatomy, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine, National University of Singapore, 117597

Singapore

Comment

We are thankful to the Bentham Science Publishers and its Reviewers for careful review of the manuscript and providing us with the constructive criticism and suggestions which greatly improved the quality of the manuscript. The reviews were fair and prompt which made us analyze our work more deeply. The scientific standard is very high, and the publication process has been smooth, efficient and of high standard. The editorial staff has always been very co-operative and gave a prompt reply to the e-mail conversations during the entire review process. Finally, we appreciate all the insightful comments of Bentham Science Publishers.

Anjana Devi Tangutur

CSIR-IICT - Centre For Chemical Biology Tarnaka-Hyderabad, Telangana

India

Comment

I would like to thank Bentham Science Publishers and its Reviewers for careful review of the manuscript and providing us with the suggestion to improve the quality of the manuscript. I did not face any trouble to work with Bentham Science Publishers starting from the submission of manuscript till the time it got published. The hard working team members gave a prompt reply and suggestions in a polite way. Bentham Science Publishers positive attitude and ability to motivate people will results in leading heights of achieving targets. Finally, I appreciate all your insightful comments. Thank you very much once again.

D. S. Pushparani

Department of Biochemistry, SRM Dental College, Ramapuram, Chennai-600089

India

Comment

I have positive opinion of your work, cooperation and helpful suggestions. All the people with whom I have already had contact in Bentham Science Publishers have patience. They are helpful and very understanding. I feel comfortable to ask everything and the cooperation is at the highest level. They take care of every single piece of the submitted document, read it carefully, pointing unequivocally where and how to prepare the manuscript better. I have already recommended the organization and I will continue to share a positive attitude of the organization.

Olga Popovska

Institute of Organic Technology, Faculty of Technology and Metallurgy, Ss. Cyril and Methodius University, Rudjer Boskovic 16, 1000, Skopje

Republic of Macedonia

Comment

It is my pleasure to disclose that i have a very pleasant experience with Bentham Science Publisher, one of the leading publishers in the scientific publications. Right from the article submission till publication, I found the entire process very smooth and looks that it is run and monitored by high-class professionals.

I invite scientists around the world to publish their mechanistic research here and feel proud like me. Obviously, I would love to contribute and to have a regular connectivity with the publisher and journal.

Haroon Khan

Department of Pharmacy, Abdul Wali Khan University, Mardan

Pakistan

Comment
